00022 /**
00023  * @file   MedNormTran.cpp

00027  * @brief  Class for doing median, or average, normalization

00040 /** 
00041  * Constructor
00042  * 
00043  * @param target - Value to set median or average value to.
00044  * @param doAverage - Do average instead of median.
00045  * @param calcTarget - Calculate target as average or median of all data.
00046  * @param lowPrecision - Should we pretend like this got wrote to a cel file and 
00047  *                       read back again (meaning truncation)
00048  */
00049 MedNormTran::MedNormTran(float target, bool doAverage, bool calcTarget, bool lowPrecision) :
00050   m_TargetNorm(target), m_DoAverage(doAverage), m_TargetUnset(calcTarget),
00051   m_LowPrecision(lowPrecision) {
00052   m_SubProbeCount = 0;
00053   m_Type = MEDNORMSTR;
00054   if(calcTarget == true && target > 0.0) {
00055     Err::errAbort("MedNormTran::MedNormTran() - Can't set target and calcTarget at same time.");
00056   }
00057   setupSelfDoc(*this);
00058   setOptValue("target", ToStr(m_TargetNorm));
00059   setOptValue("doavg", m_DoAverage);
00060   setOptValue("lowprecision", m_LowPrecision);
00061   setOptValue("calctarget", m_TargetUnset);
00062   }
00063 
00064 
00065 /** 
00066  * @brief transform the intensity point supplied coming from a particular
00067  * probe in a particular microarray.
00068  * 
00069  * @param probeIx - Probe index from the cel file.
00070  * @param chipIx - Set of chip indexes from same sample.
00071  * @param intensity - Original intensities. 
00072  * @param return - transformed intensities.
00073  */
00074 float MedNormTran::transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity) {
00075   intensity = float(intensity * m_Scale[chipIx]);
00076   if (m_LowPrecision) { 
00077     intensity = Convert::floatLowPrecision(intensity); 
00078   }
00079   return intensity;
00080 }
00081 
00082 void MedNormTran::transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity) {
00083   for (int probeIx = 0; probeIx < intensity.size(); probeIx++) {
00084     intensity[probeIx] = transform(probeIx, chipIx, intensity[probeIx]);
00085   }
00086 }

00088 /** 
00089  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00090  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00091  */
00092 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> MedNormTran::getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00093   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00094   SelfDoc::Opt target = {"target", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.0", "0.0", "0", "NA", 
00095                          "Target intensity to set all chips median (or average) to."};
00096   opts.push_back(target);
00097   SelfDoc::Opt doavg = {"doavg", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00098                         "Set to true to do average rather than median."};
00099   opts.push_back(doavg);
00100   SelfDoc::Opt calc = {"calctarget", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",
00101                        "Calculate a target from median of chips."};
00102   opts.push_back(calc);
00103   SelfDoc::Opt lowprecision = {"lowprecision", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00104                                "Set to 'true' to truncate values as seen when writing results to a normalized cel file."};
00105   opts.push_back(lowprecision);
00106   return opts;
00107 }
00108 
00109 void MedNormTran::setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00110   doc.setDocName(MEDNORMSTR);
00111   doc.setDocDescription("Class for doing median normalization. Adjust intensities such that all chips have the same median (or average).");
00112   doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00113 }

00117  * class performs and what parameters it takes.

00120 SelfDoc MedNormTran::explainSelf() {
00121   SelfDoc doc;
00122   setupSelfDoc(doc);
00123   return doc;

00126 /** 
00127  * @brief Only use a subset of all probes for normalization. For
00128  * example RMA only uses PM probes or might want to just use control
00129  * genes.
00130  * @param subsetProbes - bitmask indicating which probes to use for
00131  * normalization.
00132  */
00133 void MedNormTran::setSubProbes(const std::vector<bool> &subsetProbes) {
00134     unsigned int i = 0;
00135     m_SubProbes = subsetProbes;
00136     m_SubProbeCount = 0;
00137     for(i = 0; i < m_SubProbes.size(); i++) 
00138       if(m_SubProbes[i] == true) 
00139         m_SubProbeCount++;
00140   } 
00141 
00142 
00143 void MedNormTran::newChip(std::vector<float> &data) {
00144    initializeData(data);
00145 }
00146 
00147 /** 
00148  * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00149  * @param data - cel file vector of data.
00150  */  
00151 void MedNormTran::newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart) {
00152   int dataSetCount = iMart->getCelDataSetCount();
00153   m_TransformedIMart = iMart;
00154   // if there aren't any chipstream nodes after this, then don't store
00155   // all of the intensities
00156   if (m_Streams.empty()) {
00157     m_TransformedIMart->setStoreAllCelIntensities(false);
00158   }
00159 
00160   std::vector<float> data;
00161   for (int d = 0; d < dataSetCount; d++) {
00162     data = iMart->getCelData(d);
00163     newChip(data);
00164     if(!m_TargetUnset) {
00165       transform(d, data);
00166       m_TransformedIMart->setProbeIntensity(d, data);
00167     }
00168   }
00169   finishedChips();
00170   if(m_TargetUnset) {
00171     for (int d = 0; d < dataSetCount; d++) {
00172       data = iMart->getCelData(d);
00173       transform(d, data);
00174       m_TransformedIMart->setProbeIntensity(d, data);
00175     }
00176   }
00177   chipStreamPassNewChip(m_TransformedIMart);
00178 }
00179 
00180 /** 
00181  * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data. Calculates
00182  * and stores the median (or average) of data supplied.
00183  * @param data - cel file vector of data.
00184  */  
00185 void MedNormTran::initializeData(const std::vector<float> &data) {
00186   vector<float> copy(m_SubProbeCount);
00187   unsigned int i = 0, currentPm = 0;
00188   float summary = 0;
00189   
00190   /* Sanity check. */
00191   if(m_SubProbes.size() > 0 && data.size() != m_SubProbes.size()) 
00192     Err::errAbort("MedNormTran::newChip() - Chip data different size than subset probe vector");
00193   
00194   /* If we're doing a subset of the data, put subset into copy and
00195      normalize from copy. */
00196   if(m_SubProbes.size() > 0) {
00197     /* First filter out PM probes, for RMA only use pm probes. */
00198     for(i = 0; i < m_SubProbes.size(); i++) {
00199       if(m_SubProbes[i] == true) {
00200         copy[currentPm++] = data[i];
00201       }
00202     }
00203     /* Get summary from copy. */
00204     if(m_DoAverage)
00205       summary = float(average(copy.begin(),copy.end()));
00206     else {
00207       summary = median_in_place(copy.begin(),copy.end());
00208        Verbose::out(2, "Median for chip: " + ToStr(m_Summary.size()) + " is: " + ToStr(summary));
00209     }
00210   }
00211   else {
00212     /* Get summary from original data. */
00213     if(m_DoAverage)
00214       summary = float(average(data.begin(),data.end()));
00215     else {
00216       summary = median(data.begin(),data.end());
00217       Verbose::out(2, "Median for whole chip: " + ToStr(m_Summary.size()) + " is: " + ToStr(summary));
00218     }
00219   }
00220   if(summary <= 0) {
00221     Err::errAbort("Summary value for chip " + 
00222                      ToStr( m_Summary.size() + 1) +
00223                      " is not positive: " + ToStr(summary));
00224   }
00225   m_Summary.push_back(summary);
00226   Verbose::out(3, "Summary value for chip " + ToStr(m_Summary.size()) +
00227                " is: " + ToStr(summary));
00228   if (!m_TargetUnset) {
00229     m_Scale.push_back( m_TargetNorm / summary );
00230   }
00231 }
00232 
00233 /** 
00234  * @brief Signal that no more data is coming (i.e. newChip() will
00235  * not be called anymore. Currently the class builds up all the
00236  * summaries and figures out the normalization factores when this
00237  * function is called.  This makes it difficult to pass through data
00238  * to downstream.
00239  */
00240 void MedNormTran::setTarget() {
00241   unsigned int chipIx = 0;
00242  
00243   ///@todo handle each channel independently
00244 
00245   /* Calculate our target. */
00246   if(m_TargetUnset) {
00247     if(m_DoAverage)
00248       m_TargetNorm = average(m_Summary.begin(), m_Summary.end());
00249     else
00250       m_TargetNorm = median(m_Summary.begin(), m_Summary.end());
00251   }
00252   
00253   /* Calculate scaling factor for each chip. */
00254   for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_Summary.size(); chipIx++) {
00255     m_Scale.push_back( m_TargetNorm / m_Summary[chipIx] );
00256     Verbose::out(2, "Scale for chip: " + ToStr(chipIx) + " is: " + ToStr(m_Scale[m_Scale.size() -1]));
00257   }
00258   
00259 }
00260

00263  * not be called anymore. Currently the class builds up all the
00264  * summaries and figures out the normalization factores when this
00265  * function is called.  This makes it difficult to pass through data
00266  * to downstream.
00267  */
00268 void MedNormTran::endDataSet() {  
00269 //   if (m_InDiskMart) {
00270 //     if (m_TargetUnset) {

00272 //       for (int d = 0; d < dataSetCount; d++) {

00274 //         data = m_InDiskMart->getCelData(d);
00275 //         transform(d, data);
00276 //         m_TransformedIMart->setProbeIntensity("", data);
00277 //       }
00278 //     }
00279 //   }
00280   
00281   /* Flush data in stream. */
00282   chipStreamEndChips();
00283 }

00285 /** 
00286  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00287  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00288  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00289  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00290  * 
00291  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00292  * 
00293  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00294  */
00295 SelfCreate *MedNormTran::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00296   SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00297   float target = 0;
00298   bool lowPrecision = false;
00299   bool doAvg = false, calcTarget=false;
00300 
00301   fillInValue(target, "target", param, doc);
00302   if(target == 0) 
00303     calcTarget = true;
00304   fillInValue(doAvg, "doavg", param, doc);
00305   fillInValue(lowPrecision, "lowprecision", param, doc);
00306 
00307   MedNormTran *mNorm = new MedNormTran(target, doAvg, calcTarget, lowPrecision);
00308   return mNorm;
00309 }
